content.raw: it looks like we moved sdf definition of `<provide_feedback>` up one level from within `<joint><ode><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></ode></joint>` to `<joint><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></joint>` but we did not update `parser_urdf.cc` to translate urdf to sdf correspondingly.  While it worked when `ODEJoint` still parsed `<provide_feedback>`, but since that deprecated parsing code was removed from `ODEJoint` the feedback data never gets filled.  Removing this mechanism altogether will fix the error messages, but I think this approach might have significant impact on performance.  On another note, Simbody could also use this flag to improve performance when joint force torque is not needed.
content.html: it looks like we moved sdf definition of <provide_feedback> up one level from within <joint><ode><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></ode></joint> to <joint><provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback></joint> but we did not update parser_urdf.cc to translate urdf to sdf correspondingly. While it worked when ODEJoint still parsed <provide_feedback>, but since that deprecated parsing code was removed from ODEJoint the feedback data never gets filled. Removing this mechanism altogether will fix the error messages, but I think this approach might have significant impact on performance. On another note, Simbody could also use this flag to improve performance when joint force torque is not needed.
